version_description: Testing… testing… one two… one two. In this release, we’ve improved support for VoiceOver. Sound: On.
Testing… testing… one two… one two. In this release, we’ve improved support for VoiceOver. Sound: On.

Narwhal here, reporting live from Asana. This just in… new features for iOS 11 and an all-new iPad app! Here’s what we know so far: Put a face to a name with user profiles. Then use the like button to give quick feedback. On iPad, see your Inbox and lists side-by-side with the right pane (just like the web app), and drag and drop images right into Asana. I’ll continue to share updates as this story develops. Back to you in the studio, Yeti.

Narwhal here, reporting live from Asana. This just in… new features for iOS 11 and an all-new iPad app! Here’s what we know so far: Put a face to a name with user profiles. Then use the like button to give quick feedback. On iPad, see your Inbox and lists side-by-side with the right pane (just like the web app), and drag and drop images right into Asana. I’ll continue to share updates as this story develops. Back to you in the studio, Yeti.

Asana just dropped their hotly anticipated new EP aptly named “Calendar View" including the smash hit, “See deadlines.” Don't miss their duet with The Artist Formerly Known as Yeti on the power ballad, “Easily adjust dates."

Asana just dropped their hotly anticipated new EP aptly named “Calendar View" including the smash hit, “See deadlines.” Don't miss their duet with The Artist Formerly Known as Yeti on the power ballad, “Easily adjust dates."
For this update, the app took a restorative yoga class and stretched out some kinks. And after savasana, it's now feeling energized and ready to track your work. Namaste.
For this update, the app took a restorative yoga class and stretched out some kinks. And after savasana, it's now feeling energized and ready to track your work. Namaste.
Bonjour, hallo! Have you heard? Asana is now available in French and German. Because we want you to work the way that’s most comfortable for you. How’s that for amour?
Bonjour, hallo! Have you heard? Asana is now available in French and German. Because we want you to work the way that’s most comfortable for you. How’s that for amour?
Is ordering subtasks starting to feel like Tetris? With this update, you can now drag and drop to reorder them. It's the I-piece you've been waiting for. Level complete.
Is ordering subtasks starting to feel like Tetris? With this update, you can now drag and drop to reorder them. It's the I-piece you've been waiting for. Level complete.

Looking for a sign? Here it is. If you have comment-only access to a project, you’ll get an alert when you try to take an action that’s outside your access level. And it's now easier to see the work on your plate with visual improvements to My Tasks. As for what to eat for lunch, you'll have to keep looking.

Looking for a sign? Here it is. If you have comment-only access to a project, you’ll get an alert when you try to take an action that’s outside your access level. And it's now easier to see the work on your plate with visual improvements to My Tasks. As for what to eat for lunch, you'll have to keep looking.

We’re saying so long, farewell to supporting iOS 9. So you should say hi, hello to iOS 10 or higher so you can keep using Asana. And if you're using iOS 11, you can now drag and drop more file formats on iPad. Adieu, adieu... to you...

We’re saying so long, farewell to supporting iOS 9. So you should say hi, hello to iOS 10 or higher so you can keep using Asana. And if you're using iOS 11, you can now drag and drop more file formats on iPad. Adieu, adieu... to you...
To kick off 2018, we didn’t make resolutions... we made bug fixes. Cheers to doing great work this year.
To kick off 2018, we didn’t make resolutions... we made bug fixes. Cheers to doing great work this year.

Got the winter blues? This release is like holding a little ray of sunshine in your hand. Now it's easier to search for specific work, add start dates to tasks, and specify member level when you invite a teammate. Unfortunately, warmer temps not included.

Got the winter blues? This release is like holding a little ray of sunshine in your hand. Now it's easier to search for specific work, add start dates to tasks, and specify member level when you invite a teammate. Unfortunately, warmer temps not included.

Spectacular views! Like better filtered views for lists and boards. Enjoyable activities! Like being able to mark tasks as Today, Upcoming, or Later. And pest free! (We got rid of some bugs.) It all awaits you in this release.

Spectacular views! Like better filtered views for lists and boards. Enjoyable activities! Like being able to mark tasks as Today, Upcoming, or Later. And pest free! (We got rid of some bugs.) It all awaits you in this release.
Olá, ¡Hola! Asana is now available in Portuguese and Spanish. Viva, ¡Salud!
Olá, ¡Hola! Asana is now available in Portuguese and Spanish. Viva, ¡Salud!
In this update, we’re excited to unveil a new login and signup experience. To borrow some wise words from OutKast, it’s so fresh and so clean clean.

We got a dose of motivation and did some (early) spring cleaning. We dusted, fixed some bugs, and improved localization for numbers. That cobweb in the corner will have to wait until our next cleaning spree, though.
In this update, we’re excited to unveil a new login and signup experience. To borrow some wise words from OutKast, it’s so fresh and so clean clean.

We got a dose of motivation and did some (early) spring cleaning. We dusted, fixed some bugs, and improved localization for numbers. That cobweb in the corner will have to wait until our next cleaning spree, though.

We took “it’s the little changes that make all the difference,” to heart for this update. You can now add start and due dates to tasks with VoiceOver. And your emoji comments have been super-sized (or at least jumbo-sized when you add 3 or less). Enjoy!

We took “it’s the little changes that make all the difference,” to heart for this update. You can now add start and due dates to tasks with VoiceOver. And your emoji comments have been super-sized (or at least jumbo-sized when you add 3 or less). Enjoy!
For this release, we turned some itty bitty bugs into beautiful butterflies (you know, just tending to the garden).
For this release, we turned some itty bitty bugs into beautiful butterflies (you know, just tending to the garden).

We're taking a queue from the Fresh Prince: Now, this is a story all about our latest update... In San Francisco born and raised... On the codebase is where we spend most of our days... When a couple of engineers came up to our hood... Made it so you can attach multiple images and videos at once... And comments that include three emojis or less, we made them jumbo-size at your request... Just download it right here.

We're taking a queue from the Fresh Prince: Now, this is a story all about our latest update... In San Francisco born and raised... On the codebase is where we spend most of our days... When a couple of engineers came up to our hood... Made it so you can attach multiple images and videos at once... And comments that include three emojis or less, we made them jumbo-size at your request... Just download it right here.
In this update, we’re excited to unveil a new login and signup experience. To borrow some wise words from OutKast, it’s so fresh and so clean clean.
In this update, we’re excited to unveil a new login and signup experience. To borrow some wise words from OutKast, it’s so fresh and so clean clean.
In this update, we’re excited to unveil a new login and signup experience. To borrow some wise words from OutKast, it’s so fresh and so clean clean.
In this update, we’re excited to unveil a new login and signup experience. To borrow some wise words from OutKast, it’s so fresh and so clean clean.

Dear typos: it’s not us, it’s you. It’s time to say goodbye once and for all. So we made it official: now you can edit task comments! Just press on a task comment until “Edit Comment” appears. And voila! Better get packing, typos.

Dear typos: it’s not us, it’s you. It’s time to say goodbye once and for all. So we made it official: now you can edit task comments! Just press on a task comment until “Edit Comment” appears. And voila! Better get packing, typos.
We improved the VoiceOver accessibility for setting start and due dates on a task. Now "put it on the calendar" really can be easier said than done.
We improved the VoiceOver accessibility for setting start and due dates on a task. Now "put it on the calendar" really can be easier said than done.

While adding avocado might be extra, adding more details to your tasks isn’t. Now when you tap “Add task…” from the task list, you can add a description, assignee, attachments, and more when creating tasks. You can also attach multiple images to new tasks from the iOS Share extension. Now that's a stacked task sandwich.

While adding avocado might be extra, adding more details to your tasks isn’t. Now when you tap “Add task…” from the task list, you can add a description, assignee, attachments, and more when creating tasks. You can also attach multiple images to new tasks from the iOS Share extension. Now that's a stacked task sandwich.

We hear the clock tick, and think of you...If you’re wondering, you can look—and you will find—relative timestamps in this update. Time after time...Or 3 minutes ago. If you forget, we’ll remind you—timestamps will be waiting in task and Inbox stories. Time after time.

We hear the clock tick, and think of you...If you’re wondering, you can look—and you will find—relative timestamps in this update. Time after time...Or 3 minutes ago. If you forget, we’ll remind you—timestamps will be waiting in task and Inbox stories. Time after time.

No, we don't want no bugs. A bug is a flaw that can't get no love from us. Hangin’ out in the code strings...trying to hide from us. But we found some and squashed them...oh no, we don't want no bugs.

No, we don't want no bugs. A bug is a flaw that can't get no love from us. Hangin’ out in the code strings...trying to hide from us. But we found some and squashed them...oh no, we don't want no bugs.

It’s time to channel your inner Adele—or Drake if that’s more your style—and write your next chart-topping single with the new comment composer. By @-mentioning teammates, attaching images, taking photos and more, it’ll be a hit...at least at the office.

It’s time to channel your inner Adele—or Drake if that’s more your style—and write your next chart-topping single with the new comment composer. By @-mentioning teammates, attaching images, taking photos and more, it’ll be a hit...at least at the office.

We solemnly swear that we're up to good things with this update. Yeti, narwhal, phoenix, and unicorn are proud to present: password autofill! Now your password will autofill when you log in if it’s saved in your iCloud keychain. Mischief...err work managed.

We solemnly swear that we're up to good things with this update. Yeti, narwhal, phoenix, and unicorn are proud to present: password autofill! Now your password will autofill when you log in if it’s saved in your iCloud keychain. Mischief...err work managed.

We solemnly swear that we're up to good things with this update. Yeti, narwhal, phoenix, and unicorn are proud to present: password autofill! Now your password will autofill when you log in if it’s saved in your iCloud keychain. Mischief...err work managed.

We solemnly swear that we're up to good things with this update. Yeti, narwhal, phoenix, and unicorn are proud to present: password autofill! Now your password will autofill when you log in if it’s saved in your iCloud keychain. Mischief...err work managed.

A (not so) long time ago in an app far, far away….It was a period of multiple taps and screens. (You had to tap the pencil icon and change screens to edit task data.) Driven by the need for faster editing, this update lets you tap the task screen to edit info...and restore peace to your workload.

A (not so) long time ago in an app far, far away….It was a period of multiple taps and screens. (You had to tap the pencil icon and change screens to edit task data.) Driven by the need for faster editing, this update lets you tap the task screen to edit info...and restore peace to your workload.

A (not so) long time ago in an app far, far away….It was a period of multiple taps and screens. (You had to tap the pencil icon and change screens to edit task data.) Driven by the need for faster editing, this update lets you tap the task screen to edit info...and restore peace to your workload.

A (not so) long time ago in an app far, far away….It was a period of multiple taps and screens. (You had to tap the pencil icon and change screens to edit task data.) Driven by the need for faster editing, this update lets you tap the task screen to edit info...and restore peace to your workload.

Here’s a story...of a lovely app...who has two very lovely updates. Now when you create a task via the Quick Add button, the functionality is the same as adding a task  to a list. Plus, you can create bulleted and numbered lists in descriptions and comments. And that’s the way these updates became the latest release.

Here’s a story...of a lovely app...who has two very lovely updates. Now when you create a task via the Quick Add button, the functionality is the same as adding a task  to a list. Plus, you can create bulleted and numbered lists in descriptions and comments. And that’s the way these updates became the latest release.

Put your hands in the air and sing with with us, “Mark up for the people!” Now you can mark up images you add via the comment composer. Just compose a new comment, attach an image, tap Mark Up, and add text or draw freehand. Rock on.

“Hmm,” said a portfolio in the Asana app. “Very interesting. Plenty of project progress, I see. Not bad status updates either. There’s priority, oh my goodness, yes—and nice date ranges, now that’s interesting. . . So how should I sort the projects?” Now you can choose which project field to sort your portfolios by. Also, this is the last release that will support iOS 10, so please update your software to access future versions of our iOS app.

Put your hands in the air and sing with with us, “Mark up for the people!” Now you can mark up images you add via the comment composer. Just compose a new comment, attach an image, tap Mark Up, and add text or draw freehand. Rock on.

“Hmm,” said a portfolio in the Asana app. “Very interesting. Plenty of project progress, I see. Not bad status updates either. There’s priority, oh my goodness, yes—and nice date ranges, now that’s interesting. . . So how should I sort the projects?” Now you can choose which project field to sort your portfolios by. Also, this is the last release that will support iOS 10, so please update your software to access future versions of our iOS app.

This update includes a smorgasbord of delightful enhancements. First, you can convert images with text into new tasks that are editable and searchable in Asana. Next, feast your eyes on the + button, now in the lower right corner. Hold it down for a menu of more options! And, to top it all off, you can now add custom fields to new tasks. Bon appétit!

This update includes a smorgasbord of delightful enhancements. First, you can convert images with text into new tasks that are editable and searchable in Asana. Next, feast your eyes on the + button, now in the lower right corner. Hold it down for a menu of more options! And, to top it all off, you can now add custom fields to new tasks. Bon appétit!
Say “hello” to our little update! It’s new, it’s improved, and it’s bug free.
Say “hello” to our little update! It’s new, it’s improved, and it’s bug free.
Say “hello” to our little update! It’s new, it’s improved, and it’s bug free.
Say “hello” to our little update! It’s new, it’s improved, and it’s bug free.

Business and Enterprise flight controllers, give us a go-no-go for the Portfolios launch. Create and edit portfolios? Go. Get a high-level overview of progress? We’re a go. View and request status updates? Go, flight. View project health details? Go. Launch control, this is Asana: tap Portfolios in the bottom nav, then tap the + button (it’s now contextual), and you’re a go.

Business and Enterprise flight controllers, give us a go-no-go for the Portfolios launch. Create and edit portfolios? Go. Get a high-level overview of progress? We’re a go. View and request status updates? Go, flight. View project health details? Go. Launch control, this is Asana: tap Portfolios in the bottom nav, then tap the + button (it’s now contextual), and you’re a go.

Also, this is the last release that will support iOS 10, so please update your software to access future versions of our iOS app.

That task you’ve been looking for? The redesigned search view will help you find it. And you can now find portfolios with Spotlight search. Unfortunately, we can’t help you find your lost keys, though.

That task you’ve been looking for? The redesigned search view will help you find it. And you can now find portfolios with Spotlight search. Unfortunately, we can’t help you find your lost keys, though.
Holiday greetings! We come bearing gifts of generic bug fixes and performance improvements in this update. Just a little something for everyone.
Holiday greetings! We come bearing gifts of generic bug fixes and performance improvements in this update. Just a little something for everyone.
Holiday greetings! We come bearing gifts of generic bug fixes and performance improvements in this update. Just a little something for everyone.
Holiday greetings! We come bearing gifts of generic bug fixes and performance improvements in this update. Just a little something for everyone.

tl;dr - we fixed some bugs

iPad fixes: the “Overdue tasks” button in Project Overview > Status now works properly. Also, you’ll find “Add to project” where it should be.

Other fixes: the strikethrough icon in the rich text toolbar wasn’t where it should be. Sorry, that must have looked weird. Also, ordinal numbers now translate correctly, and, last but not least, text entry in Japanese works as it should. Out, out, darn bugs!

tl;dr - we fixed some bugs

iPad fixes: the “Overdue tasks” button in Project Overview > Status now works properly. Also, you’ll find “Add to project” where it should be.

Other fixes: the strikethrough icon in the rich text toolbar wasn’t where it should be. Sorry, that must have looked weird. Also, ordinal numbers now translate correctly, and, last but not least, text entry in Japanese works as it should. Out, out, darn bugs!

You smell that? Do you smell that? Dead bugs, son. Nothing else in the world smells like that. I love the smell of dead bugs in the morning...(er, nothing to report except for a few generic bug fixes).

You smell that? Do you smell that? Dead bugs, son. Nothing else in the world smells like that. I love the smell of dead bugs in the morning...(er, nothing to report except for a few generic bug fixes).

We’ll be there for you...when the work starts to pour. We’ll be there for you, without the same bugs as before. We’ll be there for you, ‘cause you’re there for us too...Your mother warned you there'd be bug fixes like this.

We’ll be there for you...when the work starts to pour. We’ll be there for you, without the same bugs as before. We’ll be there for you, ‘cause you’re there for us too...Your mother warned you there'd be bug fixes like this.

Images, meet proofing improvements. This handy feature lets reviewers mark up images directly in Asana, and BOOM: their feedback becomes subtasks to action. Oh, and let me introduce you to some general bug fixes, too. Cheers!

Images, meet proofing improvements. This handy feature lets reviewers mark up images directly in Asana, and BOOM: their feedback becomes subtasks to action. Oh, and let me introduce you to some general bug fixes, too. Cheers!

Yeti: Next up, we’re going to hear from Narwhal who’s live at Asana with new updates.
Narwhal: Thanks Yeti. I’ve just learned from the team here that this release includes improvements to the milestones and proofing features, and customers on paid plans will see them after they tap “Update.” Now back to you in the studio, Yeti.

Yeti: Next up, we’re going to hear from Narwhal who’s live at Asana with new updates.
Narwhal: Thanks Yeti. I’ve just learned from the team here that this release includes improvements to the milestones and proofing features, and customers on paid plans will see them after they tap “Update.” Now back to you in the studio, Yeti.

Little Miss Muffet sat on a tuffet, eating her curds and whey, when along came a spider, who sat down beside her and said, "Did you know you now have full support for creating and displaying milestones in Asana? And the app is available in Japanese!"

Little Miss Muffet sat on a tuffet, eating her curds and whey, when along came a spider, who sat down beside her and said, "Did you know you now have full support for creating and displaying milestones in Asana? And the app is available in Japanese!"

Two, four, six...um, hmm...nirvana! Here’s what’s new in Asana.
• You'll now see a privacy indicator to make it clear when you're creating a private task versus a public task.
• If you attach the wrong file you can still blame it on your thumbs, but now you can delete it so no one has to know you blamed your thumbs.

Say hello to our lil' update! This release includes general fixes and improvements.

The citronella candle of releases, this update is subtle, gets rid of small bugs, and may or may not smell like oranges.

Looking for something? This release improves search performance so you can sort through projects and tasks more easily. We also squashed a few bugs but what else is new?
Looking for something? This release improves search performance so you can sort through projects and tasks more easily. We also squashed a few bugs but what else is new?
Space, time, and pronoun options in Asana. All infinite, all important, and all available to you thanks to this latest release.

Supertramp might prefer the long way home, but we love a good shortcut. This release adds iPad keyboard shortcuts for assigning tasks, setting due dates, jumping to My Tasks, and more.

We just took a DNA test, turns out, our bugs are 100% all fixed.*

*Unconfirmed, but we did fix quite a few!

We had some kale stuck in our teeth, but this update brought us floss and a spritz of mouthwash to get that fresh Asana feeling back.

Make our users sad bug,

Glitch like it’s a fad bug.

We’re those good devs,
Code just like we should devs,
Get under the hood devs,
Like we said we would devs,
And we fixed some, bugs.

We push our update
Check our tech
Ask us how we’re feeling
Feeling good as heck

Yes we, made a few improvements
Task lists so clean the whole team will use them
Come now, come try it out

New teammates from directly in the app

One is the loneliest number... for updates, so we have three:
First, a change to inbox. Buckle up, because now you can switch between activity and archived notifications right from your inbox menu.
Two, you can approve or reject requests to join your team in app. When you receive requests, a banner will appear in the Home tab—just like it does on the web.
Last but not least, say hello to enhanced numeric fields. They’re now grouped by region, and will show currency, percent, and custom labels as long as they’re enabled on web.

Last but not least, say hello to enhanced numeric fields. They’re now grouped by region, and will show currency, percent, and custom labels as long as they’re enabled on web.

A horoscope for every sign:

You’re feeling a strong pull towards the dark. Lean into it with Dark Mode for iOS. It's also an excellent time to start reordering tasks, sections, and columns while offline. Because now you can. You may feel called upon to give approval or constructive criticism, so take advantage of Approval tasks on mobile. And…what’s this? You might want to edit your PDFs, which you can now do with proofing and annotations directly on your Asana app.

If you love getting notifications in the middle of focus work, important conversations, tense scenes in a movie, or good ol’ relaxation time… raise your hand. Anyone?

Same. In addition to bug fixes, this update includes Do Not Disturb. Mute push notifications and let your team know you're away. Whatever moment you’re in—stay in it.

Let's start with the first feature, can we get any bidders for the first feature? Looks like List View now shows a grid that displays all of a project's custom fields. Wow! Tap "Fields" to show, hide, reorder, or create a new custom field. The minimum bid is a download. Can we get a download?

Thank you, download! Next we have the new and improved Inbox. Tap "Expand" to see more details about your notifications. Would you look at that! You can also swipe to take quick actions, like archiving or creating a follow-up task. All this could be yours for just a download. Can we get a download?

But wait, there's more! We're also throwing in bug fixes and improvements. Going once, going twice, gone!

Let's start with the first feature, can we get any bidders for the first feature? Looks like List View now shows a grid that displays all of a project's custom fields. Wow! Tap "Fields" to show, hide, reorder, or create a new custom field. The minimum bid is a download. Can we get a download?

Thank you, download! Next we have the new and improved Inbox. Tap "Expand" to see more details about your notifications. Would you look at that! You can also swipe to take quick actions, like archiving or creating a follow-up task. All this could be yours for just a download. Can we get a download?

But wait, there's more! We're also throwing in bug fixes and improvements. Going once, going twice, gone!

Definition of update (up-det): An updated version of your favorite work management app. In addition to bug fixes, this update includes:
• Goals (gol): A person or team's aim. Browse and update the status of goals in Asana on iOS.
• iOS Widget (wijit): A component of the Asana app. View tasks due today with small, medium, and large widget options.

• A new option for Status updates: "On hold."

You have (1) new message. Click here to read it. Or press "Update" for more options.

Send messages to multiple people, projects, or teams in Asana. You can @-mention projects, tasks, or collaborators without switching tools. Or create a follow-up task that links to a message for easy access.

This update also includes bug fixes and improvements.

Nothing says "good job" like a yeti riding a unicorn while holding a task complete banner. Now, you can send Appreciations directly from the Asana app. So go ahead and dance like a unicorn at a disco party — you deserve it.

Gettin' griddy wit it

Look familiar? We just launched grid view in My Tasks. That means you can see the same grid view on your phone as you do on desktop. We also refreshed the task details main page so you get clear and easy access to projects, subtasks, and a big tempting "add attachment" button. And it’s now easier to share stuff. This update also includes bug fixes and improvements, per ush.

Look familiar? We just launched grid view in My Tasks. That means you can see the same grid view on your phone as you do on desktop. We also refreshed the task details main page so you get clear and easy access to projects, subtasks, and a big tempting "add attachment" button. And it’s now easier to share stuff. This update also includes bug fixes and improvements, per ush.

Gettin' griddy wit it

Do you think silence is awkward? We kind of love it. The sweet, sweet sound of nothing exciting. Kind of like this update. Gives us a chance to listen for the birds. And bugs. And other general improvements.

This month we are rolling out collapsed shuffle. It's not a new dance move. It means that tasks aren't cluttered with lots of extra story updates. Now you’ll see a “Show previous updates” option, just like the web version.

New Olympic sports this year: skateboarding, karate, sport climbing, and surfing. New app language support: Korean, Italian, Dutch, Traditional Chinese (Chinese-TW), and Swedish. Brb, looking up how to say “gold medal” in every language.
This update also includes bug fixes and general improvements.
